intro: Leobordea platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited leobordea, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. The fruit is a follicle, containing several seeds that are dispersed by wind.
